description: Not only is Cider awesome, its more complete than iTunes or Apple music is and works as well as if Apple themselves wrote the app. Phenomenal job, community... now make us a good replacement for the adobe suite, please!
Works great, easy setup - simply amazing.
Beautiful. The integration is really well done.

Works perfect. But there is a newer release with more features.
Get the newest release here : https://cider.sh/
This version is now deprecated but Cider 2 is available for a few dollars. This version also doesn't work with security key enabled accounts
The flatpak version is working fine on fedora 36.
Been waiting for a fully featured Apple Music client for a long time. Simple to use and includes all the features I expect. Well done!
The experience is much better than the web player and Cider is miles ahead of even the original iTunes app. Good job!

Please take my money, this is the best thing ever, even Apple couldn't take the time to develop this and you took the time to. I love you thank you. Its even faster than Apple's web version. Outstanding.

A fully-featured Apple Music player, with all the options you want and more I didn't even know I wanted until using this app. Runs flawlessly on Fedora 35 (flathub source). Discord integration also works perfectly, it shows playing a game called "Cider" or "Apple Music" (you can pick how it is displayed), with the track you are listening to, along with album art, how much time is left on the track and links to listen on Cider or View on Apple Music (unsure if these work). 
Finally I don't need to have a perpetually running Firefox tab for my music. Thank you.

It's great app with a simular design to that of Apple Music but all the controls and menus are actually in places that expect them to be in. What to add a song to your library? Right click and add. Done. No searching for little hidden menu buttons.

Works very well.
summary: Great App. Better then Apple Music on MacOS

description:
There have been a few released updates that the application doesn't work at all (processes launch, but no GUI) and requires going back to a previous commit 60b00c75bb661ceea9d32c349d249ec6c26a9f4f588fafcb0e1c2cad6312b075 is a current example and the second time that this has happened.

The 'love' a track interface is wonky and sometimes requires a few clicks to make sure that you have properly loved a track
summary: It's better than the web app, when it launches

description:
Finally a well-integrated open-source Apple Music client! The design is perfect for me, the performance could be a bit better - but it exceeded my expectations, and by a lot. Also, huge plus is the attention to detail (native window decoration option, MPRIS integration, etc).

It's not perfect, nor complete, but leaves most of the official solutions far behind (and not just talking about Apple Music here).

Thank you for your work!
summary: A surprise to be sure but a welcome one

description: Very well done, by far the best option for Apple Music users on Linux.

This is the most insane thing I've seen on Linux. A complete and masterful recreation of Apple Music with autoplaying lyric support, themes that match the artwork, and just a rock solid stable performance. It's also constantly updated which is so nice to see. 

Even on my Mac, I'm never going back to the Apple music app/itunes. It's Cider from here on out.
10/10. Perfection.
If Gapple Mooshic doesnt want to give us a client then someone will make a better client from scratch. Cider is one of em. Better than the stock music app on macos and iTunes on windows.
summary: Better than iTunes and Music on MacOS

description: Works well and a lot faster than the Apple Music Web App.
summary: A lot better than the Web Version

description: Way better than using the Apple Music web app. Cider has a clean interface, easy to use, and good audio quality. Almost looks like a native Apple application!
Excellent! Would recommend
Looks and feels even better than any original client!

I love that it's on flathub. It works perfecly. Even the discord integration works without any probleems on Fedora LInux. I am just amazed with this app. Please consider trying it out. (The remote app feature works as well)
Better user experience than iTunes, on par with the official Apple Music client.
Cider is perfect, thanks!
Sounds amazing, far better than web player, clean interface, just plain amazing.
Great attention to detail. I love this app.

Not only does it look great it runs great too. As someone else said it is way WAY better than the web client apple offers. I was a little bit disappointed in the lack of the app's ability to follow my breeze theming and button placement, as it is an electron app. But thanks to the healthy amount of customization I found in this app's settings, right down to theming support, that was easily taken care of for the most part.
Much better than music.apple.com. Apple shall fire all their Music web frontend enginners.
summary: Great app for Linux Apple Music users

description: The UI is great and it overall works perfectly.
Will be using this until need not to, would be nice for a Proper Gnome interface; but this app does look very nice!

This is the best apple music client I have come across, this is even better than the garbage apple music website , which apple dared call an decent web app. This has all the features I need and more, the only thing I would like the devs to maybe try is integration with the gnome desktop, the look is fine but a native app would look so much better.
summary: Apple should buy this and make this an official app

description: Works amazing in desktop mode - unfortunately it just crashes in gaming mode, can't find a fix anywhere.
The fact that it shows both podcasts and music in the same application is a big deal for me. Nice and performant, no real issues to complain of!

Amazing application. I have been looking for a better applicaiton to use for apple music on windows but found this on steam deck. Can't wait to add it to my main desktop as well. The GUI is pretty great and similar to apple music on Mac OS. Plus, with the Cider Adrenaline Processor I can't tell the difference between it and lossless audio.
one star less due to electron
it works well enough. i just dont understand why it keeps asking me to log back in. it gets really annoying

can hear a difference, it's just me. nice attempt to close the gap with adrenaline, but it's just not that last few percent that does make a big difference. especially in front of the computer. not so much in the gym or running. but sitting down, in front of the pc, need the lossless. otherwise, really beautiful interface, super appreciate the work. just with apple would bring lossless to linux. :(

Apple should use the smoothness and polish of Cider in their advertising for Apple Music - if you didn't know any better, you'd assume this is just the way that the service was meant to be used. Full featured but doesn't feel 'heavy' to use, but it still has that elegance that Apple was known for.
summary: A more Apple-like app than Apple itself can make anymore..

description: The Spotify flatpak app has a broken interface, like buttons and drop downs in the settings that just don't work. This Apple Music flatpak works great.

I am a new Linux user, coming from Windows and I really wanted to find a Apple Music player for Linux, and I found Cider. Cider is just brillhant! I wanted to thank cryptofyre a lot because it looks very good, simple, and fast, it is even better then the Apple Music for Mac one. Thank you for this project. Please, support this project ko-fi.com/cryptofyre.
Better than Mac or Windows official apps.
summary: I really love this app, it is the best apple music app avaliable

description: I am an Apple user and I was looking for a way to play my apple music library on my linux devices because ironically I am also a huge fan of open source software and I happened accross this incredible peice of software. Thank you for the work I know people have put into this. It is a smooth experience and the software feels very clean and modern. The only thing it's missing is offline downloads but that's to be expected considering apple's proprietary ecosystem. Please keep up the good work.
This even tops apple's mac app, by far! Terrific work.
works great just wished it had gapless playback. Gapless playback might not be possible though.

I've had zero issues with it so far!
Discord presence works as well with no issue.

i didnt expect an apple music cilent would actually came up as a search result 
and i am grateful for that now this steam deck + steamOS make me fall in love with this OS even more

maybe i will just replace macOS + windows completely in the future !
Works really well
even doe not want to try play video....
Coming from windows and this is far better than the offerings from Apple there.
Perfect the best music player so far
It's just as bad as any electon-like application to work with wayland

Never had an issue with Cider, it works SO much better than the official Apple Music app that was just released on Windows.
The design is nice, very pleasing to use.
Has plenty of plugins available to download and install in the settings as well, so you can customize Cider to a degree.
The Discord integration works wonderfully!
5 stars from me!
summary: Hand down, the best Apple Music client on Linux!

description: Besg alternative to Apple music.

It's funny that in the very moment you open the app it offers you a 50% discount to buy an app for Windows. 

Folks, no.

Otherwise, it works pretty well. Quite happy with this.

PS -- if you sell Cider 2 in Flathub I would pay for it, why not?
summary: Works well, but it takes you... to... the... Microsoft Store?

description: CANT OPEN SO BAD

1.5.9 and 1.6.1 versions don't work anymore. The first one doesn't play the music, the last one doesn't have a log in screen. Unusable. Utterly disappointed. Seems the app is abandoned for a so called cider 2 which is not available on the steam deck.

This app was pretty good when I started using it half a year ago, but is currently non-functional on my system. The app stopping syncing with my Apple Music a month ago and now launches into a blank window even with a reinstall.

I found out via their GitHub that Cider 1 is EOL and will not be maintained; this is because they are currently developing a Cider v2. Unfortunately, Cider 2 is only available as a Beta on the Microsoft Store, with no news on when it will come to Flathub.

Unless Cider 2 arrives on Flathub in a week or two, I'll probably just go back to the Apple Music website and uninstall Cider, since there's no point in keeping a broken app installed on my system.
summary: Cider 1 EOL'd before Cider 2 is out

description:
Right now it's just a fancy front for the Apple Music website. It has no features expected from a desktop app (downloads, lossless, etc).

Also, the app is practically abandoned in its current state, since the devs are actively working in a new version 2 that's going to be released on Microsoft Store and Steam.

You can even see how abandoned this version is by clicking on the Cider icon on the top left corner: there's an offer to download Cider 2 from the Microsoft Store. In a Linux OS?

I'll stick to the web version for now. It's better than this scam.
Don't waste your time, guys. It doesn't wok.
Couldn't get last.fm scrobbling working and it's buggy when played through Steam Deck's Gaming Mode. Other than that, works fine.

Everything about Cider is straight forward and seamless. I was able to sign into my Apple Music account and my music was all displayed beautifully in the GUI. I even prefer this to Apple's own Music app in almost every aspect.

The sound processing and equalization options are excellent, especially as a Steam Deck user. I have customized it to sound very good on the built in speakers. I use this app daily and it will continue to be my primary music app on Deck OS.

The only request / complaint I have is that both in fullscreen video mode and in mini-player mode, there is an intrusively bright and large circle with an X in it to clsoe out of that mode. I really wish that X button would fade from view when watching a video after a few seconds and appear if the mouse moves, same for the mini-player. With that it would be perfect.

Thank you for all of your work on this app!
Amazing, its all i ever wanted when i was on windows, and now i can have it in linux!

Seems fine at first, then the clunk factor kicks in hard. Selecting a song can take several attempts, closing and re-opening the app has a decent chance of signing you out (been signed out twice today). Really trash qualtiy. Expected better from this dev team.
LIT, Beautiful design, easy to use and familiar
summary: aye apple music on my SD

description: looks alr but it just aint working
perfect I have everything what I want in Fedora

Cider has been a go to application for me for a long time, but with the security situation getting worse and worse, and more and more vendoring (rightly) requiring 2FA, this is no longer useful to me until logging in with a security key is fixed. Perhaps this is a limitation of flatpak, and nothing the developers can fix.
If you do not have a FIDO security key for your account, this is a great application and has been for quite a while.
I kept entering the right password on my Apple Music account, but I keep getting the Invalid CORS Request message.
A great apple music client
If you're wanting to use this on Wayland, just use the Apple Music web player.
summary: Works great on X11 but horrible one Wayland

description:
I installed with high hopes and for the first few minutes, Cider hit the mark... and then :-(

Music stops playing part way through a song, and only an application restart will fix it. On restart - I get the joy of having to sign in using my AppleID again and another round of 2FA.

Maybe one day, I will try this out again but for now, I think uninstall is my best option.
works great there are even some features that are not available on the iphone/mac apple app

Rarely I've had an opportunity to listen entire track, as Cider stops to play it just like that, 'cause why not? Music is to enjoy, not frustrare with constatnt breaks...
uninstall.....
macht was es soll

Absolutely the best option if you want to listen to Apple Music on Linux whatsoever.
The app looks clean, is structured very well and connects flawlessly to your Apple ID.
I can only say thank you
summary: Better than all Apple Music Apps from Apple

description: Really nice program

Ich nutze sie täglich, und war mit dem streaming über Browser bei Apple schon länger nicht zufrieden. Das Programm ist genial und viel schöner, als das was Apple so bietet. Endlich Apple Music streamen auf meinem Linux-Rechner. Danke an die Entwickler, die echt viel Hirn, Verstand und sehr viel Herz in dieses Programm gelegt haben.
Ya no es gratis, se supone que era un proyecto de código libre.
Conecta perfectamente y se configura con facilidad, la mejor hasta ahora para Apple Music en este entorno.
summary: Excelente. Hasta ahora perfecto en Ubuntu 20.04

description: La mejor app para escuchar apple music en linux

Tengo unos cuantos albums comprados en itunes y no me los reproduce, parece ser que la aplicación es solo para la musica en streaming con la suscripción, nada no me vale la aplicación debería poder reproducir también la musica comprada.

Lo que mas me crispa es que siendo una aplicación incompleta parece que ta van pidiendo limosna para la version 2 que encima solo esta disponible en la store de Microsoft, en fin que seguire tirando de itunes oficial en wine...
Es un buen cliente para los que utilizamos Apple Music funcional sin mayor problema, la unica pega es que no he conseguido cerrar la ventana y que se reproduzca en segundo plano.
Works really nicely, juste une bug when streaming trough airplay on my homepod mini, it plays like in slow motion... but other than that, perfect, and elegant.
Для тех у кого есть подписка на apple music, есть iphone, но нет macbook. Работает намного лучше чем web версия.
У меня ~2000 треков в коллекции. При нажатии на кнопку "Песни" приложение начинает очень сильно лагать и не отвечать на нажатия мыши.
Throws out during registration, a message about problems with the connection

When I am trying to login got
message about problems with the connection:
Problem connecting. There may be a network issue.

I have disabled firewalls etc.

для тех у кого есть яблочная подписка, очень хорошо.
немного мешает то, что постоянно при запуске приложения требуется вход, но учитывая удобный интерфейс и практичность смелые 5 звезд
I can't login, because the login site was empty, and it still didn't work with proxy...
